newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Senate panels approve corporate tax bill.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Senate panels approve corporate tax bill.

text.p: The Economic Affairs and Constitution and Justice committees of the Brazilian Senate Thursday approved a bill overhauling the corporate tax system, an official said.
The Senate official said the bill would go to the full floor of the upper house later on Thursday.

The new bill, which takes effect in 1997, eliminates the so-called transfer price, a measure which has allowed multinational firms to pay less tax by underreporting exports and overvaluing imports at their Brazilian subsidiaries.
The bill also allows for deductions for poor-performing loans, charges tax on real profit and not presumed profit and changes the schedule for corporate tax payments to quarterly from monthly.
